CSSRule.summary: The CSSRule interface represents a single CSS rule. There are several types of rules which inherit properties from CSSRule.

CSSRuleCssText.summary:
The cssText property of the
interface returns the actual text of a style-rule.

blockquote.para:
Do not confuse this property with element-style
.

remarks.para:
Be aware that this property used to be mutable but is now read-only. Attempting to
set it does absolutely nothing, and doesn't even emit a warning or error.
Furthermore, it has no settable sub-properties. Therefore, to modify it, use the
stylesheet's {{domxref("CSSRuleList", "cssRules[index]")}} properties
and
(or its sub-properties). See Using dynamic styling information for details.

CSSRuleCssText.value: A string containing the actual text of the rule.

CSSRuleParentRule.summary:
The parentRule property of the
interface returns the containing rule of the current rule if this exists, or otherwise
returns null.
CSSRuleParentRule.value: A which is the type of the containing rules. If the current rule is inside a media query, this would return . Otherwise it returns null.

CSSRuleType.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The read-only type property of the
interface is a deprecated property that returns an integer
indicating which type of rule the represents.

remarks.para: If you need to distinguish different types of CSS rule, a good alternative is to use constructor.name:

CSSRuleType.value: The values CSSRule.UNKNOWN_RULE (0), CSSRule.CHARSET_RULE (2), CSSRule.DOCUMENT_RULE (13), CSSRule.VIEWPORT_RULE (14), and CSSRule.REGION_STYLE_RULE (16) cannot be obtained anymore.

CSSRuleParentStyleSheet.summary:
The parentStyleSheet property of the
interface returns the object in which
the current rule is defined.
